definition: to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: I screamed in pain as the knife cut the surface layer of my skin.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮肤被割开了，我痛苦的嘶叫着。

sentences.english: The black horse screamed loudly, a cry of fear.
sentences.chinese: 黑骏马大声嘶叫起来，那是一种充满恐惧的叫喊。

sentences.english: The ass felt quite proud. He lifted his voice_and_brayed, but then everyone knew him.
sentences.chinese: 驴感到很得意，他高声地嘶叫，却被人认了出来。

sentences.english: This ancestor screamed and pounded the walls, and no one came.
sentences.chinese: 这一祖先嘶叫并捶击墙壁，而没有人前来。

sentences.english: The sound of a horse whinnying broke the silence of the cell.
sentences.chinese: 一声马的嘶叫打破了牢房的沉寂。

sentences.english: The mare whined when she saw her master.
sentences.chinese: 这匹母马见到主人时会嘶叫。
驴感到很得意，他高声地嘶叫，却被人认了出来。

sentences.english: The first man entered the tent. The horse didn't neigh.
sentences.chinese: 第一个人进了帐篷，马没有嘶叫。

sentences.english: I’d just harden my eyes and hiss back.
sentences.chinese: 我只是沉下目光，冲他们嘶叫回去。

sentences.english: Then he quieted down and let out some happy brays .
sentences.chinese: 接着，他安静下来，还快乐地放声嘶叫。

sentences.english: The donkey brayed and tried to bolt.
sentences.chinese: 这头驴嘶叫着试图脱缰而逃。

sentences.english: The sailors all laughed at me because I walked and neighed like a horse.
sentences.chinese: 水手们都嘲笑我，因为我像一匹马那样走路和嘶叫。

sentences.english: The ass felt quite proud. He lifted his voice and brayed, but then everyone knew him.
sentences.chinese: 驴感到很得意，他高声地嘶叫，却被人认了。

sentences.english: His horse neighed and his groom looked back at Ch'u.
sentences.chinese: 他的马悲哀地嘶叫着，马夫也回头望着楚国叹气。

definition: to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
(of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to cry out/to bark out a sound
